result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hajji Y. McReynolds

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 1:50 PM)
No appearance by Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State indicates that the Defendant called their office this morning and advised that he is ill and was heading to the emergency room; DA's Office directed him to contact Attorney Hillestad.  Attorney Hillestad makes a record of his recent contact with the Defendant.  Defendant is not present via Zoom.  State indicates that Defendant also has an active warrant from probation/parole.  State requests a warrant - so ordered.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: CK 43916 mailed to N.M.; cash bond adjusted down, balance returned to payer.

Conditions:
No contact with T.K. or their residence, school, and place of employment.

Conditions:
No contact with T.K. or their residence, school, and place of employment.

(2:20 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds in court without counsel.
Court notes the Public Defender's Office is working on appointing counsel but hasn't been able to do so at this point. 
Court advises will adjourn the hearing to allow time for counsel to be appointed. 
Defendant wants to proceed without counsel.
State advises is ready to proceed.
Defendant requests to address bond. State advises bond can be addressed today.
Defendant makes argument for the cash bond to be modified to a $2,500.00 cash bond from a $10,000.00 cash bond.
State makes argument for bond conditions to remain in effect and has no objection to the bond being reduced to a $2,500.00 cash bond from $10,000.00.
Court grants the request for the bond to be amended from $10,000.00 cash to $2,500.00 cash with conditions remaining in effect. (bond previously posted.)
Defendant advises can scheduled preliminary hearing a ways out as wants counsel appointed.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

Conditions: 
No contact with T.K. or their residence, school, and place of employment

Case called at 1:28 PM.
Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds appeared in custody without counsel.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with.  Defendant requests additional time to prepare for the Preliminary Hearing and obtain counsel.
Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing. 
Attorney Karl Schmidt is present in the courtroom and indicates that the Public Defender's Office to revisit the Defendant's qualification paperwork as the Defendant believes he no qualifies.
Defendant requests bond modification. Bond to be reviewed next week at the Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary Hearing: 5/10/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:09 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt. 
State requests $10,000 cash bond with argument- So ordered. Defense advises they defendant may be able to secure the bond with real estate. Defendant told to request appropriate paperwork if he wished to do so. 
A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 5-3-22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with T.K. or their residence, school, & place of employment.
Exhibits filed by defendant, received via USPS mail 04/20/2022.
with Warrant to be filed separately.
